name: Hotel Papa Germano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very excited to discover a real value place that worth the money.We found the reception employees really helpfull and kind.They received us friendly, explaining us the map in every particulary, giving us suggestions what to visit in a short time, where to eat god and cheap.Regarding the room we can say that were very clean with all comforts, in a word seemed to be like home.The hotel is at only 10 minutes from the main station, and in the same time central.
reviews.title: best place where I've been

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and secure accomodation in Rome. Price was reasonable and it is only a few blocks from the train station.
reviews.title: Reasonable accomodation in Rome

likes.disliked: — neighbourhood wasn't the best, felt a little uncomfortable walking at night.

reviews.text: The owners were nice. They have an excellent internet setup that is very reasonably priced. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: What a find!!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, friendly staff, accessibility to Termini.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this place, as far as hostels go it is quite nice.
reviews.title: Great Place/Location!

reviews.text: I almost hate to rave about the place lest they become too popular and difficult to book in the future.
reviews.title: Outstaning Value, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At €105 per night for a double with bathroom, you will be hard pressed to find better in Rome. It's a bit dated but the rooms are a decent size, clean and beds comfortable, although 2 singles pushed together. No safe in room. Location is a bit dodgy but only 10 min walk to termini or barbican metro. Can also walk to colosseum, pantheon and trevi fountain. We also caught the number 40 bus a few times. Breakfast is poor, we didnt bother after the first day. There is a small cafe around the corner on via volturno where you can get an excellent coffee and pastry for €1.40. Internet free but very slow, gave up trying in the end. Basically, if you are on a budget, stay here, if not, stay further west.
reviews.title: Good Value, OK location, poor breakfast.

reviews.text: I really cannot understand how this place is so highly recommended. It wasn't TERRIBLE, but I would recommend friends or family to seek another place, whether or not they were after hostel accommodation. Of course there are pros, but there were cons too. Perhaps we dont appreciate Rome's standard and maybe it's really low, but we just found this place to be lax. We pre-booked months in advance via the hotel on their website and were given room 110 on level 2 (a quad room for 95 euros a night if paid in cash, booked directly through the hotel) which had two bunk beds and a double (2 singles pushed together). Here are the pros and cons in no particular order...
reviews.title: All right but would not return

reviews.text: CONS
reviews.title: Good rooms and price

reviews.text: - The room was clean enough, but the bathroom floor had some pubic hair - bleh. shower was really bad - about 4 water shoots, the stall was tiny and filled up after under 2 minutes.
reviews.title: A lovely place :)

reviews.text: - Breakfast was REALLY crap. Even for a cheap included breakfast, there was absolutely nothing - pre packaged croissants covered in sugar, some jams, 2 types of cereal in plastic cups and some tea and coffee. We only ate in once in 4 days becuase there was just nothing there - I really felt like they could at least include some fruit or other pastries?
reviews.title: The best place to stay for the people!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room, a 4 person dorm, was clean and quiet and on the fifth floor (no lift). There are no lockers or telephone or television in the room I stayed in. The other guests were a mellow and nice bunch, not rowdy party goers. The shared bathroom was clean and there was a small refrigerator in the hall which was handy for cooling a drink in the otherwise warm beverage city of Rome.
reviews.title: A good value

reviews.text: The beds (twin sized) were comfortable and the hotel was clean. A small fan was provided and appeciated. This hotel, like all others in this price range does not have air conditioning. There are no laundry facilities but there are some cheap 2 hour laundry services within a block of the hotel. There were also lots of internet cafes within 3 minutes of the hotel.
reviews.title: A long way to the top.
We would stay again
reviews.text: The accomodations are basic, but a good value if you're just looking for a place to sleep and shower while conquering Rome.

reviews.title: it's alright
reviews.text: The breakfast was reasonable by Italian standards; rolls, meat, cheese, juices, coffee and cereal.

I found the location, several blocks from the train / metro station, to be very handy for getting around Rome. The real plus was the staff. I found them to be friendly, easy to get along with and very helpful in answering questions or helping with directions.
reviews.title: Okay not too bad

reviews.text: Very pleasant owners who speak English. We had a dorm room which was fine, some have a fan as well. Nice and clean, located close to Termini station (but this isn't the nicest area in Rome). Only one problem- they tend to move people during their stay, so you get all cosy in one room and then they moved us after 2 days for reasons unknown. Breakfast was nothing special, but then we have just been around Italy for 2 weeks and most were not great.
reviews.title: Nice cheap hostel
Perfect cost and location
reviews.text: Good value for money! Breakfast is included, and it is an excellent breakfast. Staff all speak English and are helpful. Well kept and clean. Right by the Termini station; easy to find and within walking distance of everything you need.
Only con: the stairs. Our room was on the top floor, and trust me, it is a hike up. By the third day however, you'll be broken into it.
reviews.title: graet value and location

reviews.text: Four of us shared a quad room and it was very nice - clean and safe, quiet,decent beds,spotless bathrooms, good continental breakfast. Internet was cheap, staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was perfect, only a 5 min walk from termini station. Price was much cheaper than other hotels in area for 4 people. Overall we were very happy!!
reviews.title: It's alright

reviews.text: Papa Germano, to be fair is a get-what-you-pay-for situation. (Which is interesting since Rome is already a little on the expensive side). It is for the economical and budegt-minded traveler. It's INCREDIBLY dark on the 3rd floor. The beds are clean and the bathrooms are decent, minus the shower that malfunctioned on me. However, otherwise it was decent. The staff was extremely nice. They were mulitilingual, catering to English and Asian guests most warmly. The incuded breakfast was modest but definitely did the trick, since big breakfasts aren't really the norm in Italy anyway. Personally, I probably wouldn't stay there again but it's not unbearable especially if you're the backpacking kind.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!

description: 2 star hotel, recently renovated, located near the station Termini, few minutes walking from the main attractions and points of interest. Rooms with/without private bath with air conditioning, sat TV, telephone and hairdryer. Since 1969. Recommended by international travel guides.
